SHINOY M.J wrote:

> hello
> i want to know whether the junit is an  automated testing tool for an
> already developed software.
> 
> 

JUnit can be used for software that has already been written.  However, 
you still need to write the tests - it can't just "test" software 
without knowing anything about it.  And you may also find that your 
legacy code is very hard to test.  This is because of design problems 
with code that was not written with testing in mind - tight coupling 
between components, and interfaces that are hard to set up and use.  You 
may have to make changes in your existing code to make it testable at all.

Try writing some JUnit tests for your existing classes and find out just 
what your problems are.  And in the future, use JUnit as an integral 
part of your coding process, rather than something you do after the code 
is done!  You'll work faster and produce *much* better code.
